story.text: NEW YORK Jan 3 U.S. government bond prices rose on Wednesday after minutes from the Dec. 12 Federal Reserve policy-setting meeting said the subdued tone of economic data showed that downside risk to economic growth had increased. Benchmark 10-year notes US10YT=RR rose 3/32 in price for a yield of 4.67 percent, compared with 4.68 percent just before the minutes were released and 4.68 percent late on Tuesday. Bond yields and prices move inversely.
story.title: treasuries prices rise after dec fed meeting minutes
